_1: project_title: User-visible title of the project.
_2: repo_name: Preferably lowercase codename, used for the directory structure and Python modules.
_3: include_celery: Include Celery with Redis as the broker.  [yes/no]
_4: include_docs: Include docs generated by Sphinx.  [yes/no]
_5: domain_name: Production domain name of the site (e.g. example.com). NOTE: should be lowercase.
_6: test_host: Hostname of your test server.
_7: live_host: Hostname of your live server.
_8: admin_email: Administrative email (for Django, Letâ€™s Encrypt, etc).
_9: docker_base_image: Which base Docker images to use?  [alpine/debian]
_10: python_version: Which python version to use? [>= 3.6]
_11: node_version: Which Node.js version to use?  [10 >=]
_12: postgres_version: Which version Postgres container to use in the server?  [9/10/11/12]
_13: django_admin_path: URL path for Django Admin.
_14: django_media_engine: Which CDN to use for media files [S3/GCS].
_15: gitlab_repo_url: Optional Gitlab repo url (https://gitlab.com/org/repo, used for CI badges).
_16: frontend_style: Which type of frontend to use [webapp/spa].
_17: webapp_include_storybook: Webapp only: Include storybook configuration.
_18: spa_django_host_prefix: SPA only: Domain prefix for django site [office]
_19: use_mypy: Use MyPy static types checker [yes/no]
